greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of permutations of length n with k inversions that avoid the "dashed pattern" 1-32.
comment: Row n has length 1 + binomial(n,2) and sum A000110(n) (a Bell number).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..50, flattened
A. M. Baxter, Algorithms for Permutation Statistics, Ph. D. Dissertation, Rutgers University, May 2011.
Andrew Baxter, Additional terms, formatted as a table.
Andrew M. Baxter and Lara K. Pudwell, Enumeration schemes for dashed patterns, arXiv preprint arXiv:1108.2642, 2011
Jean-Christophe Novelli, Jean-Yves Thibon, Frédéric Toumazet, Noncommutative Bell polynomials and the dual immaculate basis, arXiv:1705.08113 [math.CO], 2017.
maple: b:= proc(u, o) option remember; expand(`if`(u+o=0, 1,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(0, n)):
mathematica: b[u_, o_] := b[u, o] = Expand[If[u+o == 0, 1, Sum[b[u-j, o+j-1]* x^(o+j-1), {j, 1, u}] + Sum[If[u == 0, b[u+j-1, o-j]*x^(o-j), 0], {j, 1, o}]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}] ][b[0, n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 01 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: The column limits are given by A188920.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 13 2011
